member.name: T:EnvDTE90.Debugger3
member.summary: is used to interrogate and manipulate the state of the debugger and the program being debugged. supersedes the and interfaces.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.AllBreakpointsLastHit
member.summary: Gets a collection of bound breakpoints that were last simultaneously hit.

member.name: M:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.Break(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Causes the given process to pause its execution so that its current state can be analyzed.
member.param: Set to true to return only when the debugger has entered break mode. Set to false to break and return immediately. For more information, see How to: Break Execution.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.BreakpointLastHit
member.summary: Gets the last breakpoint hit.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.Breakpoints
member.summary: Gets a collection of breakpoints.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.CurrentMode
member.summary: Gets the current mode of the debugger within the context of the IDE.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.CurrentProcess
member.summary: Gets or sets the active process.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.CurrentProgram
member.summary: Sets or returns the active program.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.CurrentStackFrame
member.summary: Gets or sets the current stack frame.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.CurrentThread
member.summary: Gets or sets the current thread being debugged.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.DebuggedProcesses
member.summary: Gets the list of processes that are being debugged.

member.name: M:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.DetachAll
member.summary: Detaches from all attached programs.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.DTE
member.summary: Gets the top-level extensibility object.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.ExceptionGroups
member.summary: Gets the exception settings for the debugger. For each exception, these settings determine whether the debugger gives the code an opportunity to handle the exception before the debugger breaks execution.

member.name: M:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.ExecuteStatement(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Executes the specified statement. If the flag is true, then the string is interpreted as an expression, and output is sent to the Command Window.
member.param: The statement to execute.
The timeout period, in milliseconds.
true if the string is to be interpreted as an expression; otherwise false.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.ForceContinue
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the debugger breaks or continues when a tracepoint or breakpoint finishes executing a macro. The default behavior is set by the user in the dialog box when the tracepoint or breakpoint is created. This property can be used to change the default behavior.
member.returns: A Boolean value that is true if continuation will be forced; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.GetExpression(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Evaluates an expression based on the current stack frame. If the expression can be parsed but not evaluated, an object is returned but does not contain a valid value.
member.param: The expression text to be evaluated.
true if the auto-expand rules should be used; otherwise, false.
The timeout period in milliseconds.

member.name: M:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.GetExpression2(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Evaluates an expression based on the current stack frame. If the expression can be parsed but not evaluated, an object is returned but does not contain a valid value. This member function is similar to but with an additional Boolean parameter, which can be set to true to indicate that the expression is to be evaluated as a statement.
member.param: The expression text to be evaluated.
true if the auto-expand rules should be used; otherwise, false.
true if the expression text should be treated as a single statement; otherwise, false.
The timeout period in milliseconds.

member.name: M:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.Go(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Starts executing the program from the current statement.
member.param: Set to true if this function call should wait until either Break mode or Design mode is entered before returning. Set to false if you want this call to return immediately after causing the debugger to begin execution. Upon return, the debugger could be in Design, Break, or Run modes. See Execution Control for more information.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.HexDisplayMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the expressions are output in hexadecimal or decimal format.
member.returns: A Boolean that is true if hexadecimal format; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.HexInputMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the expressions are evaluated in hexadecimal or decimal format.
member.returns: A Boolean that is true if hexadecimal format; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.Languages
member.summary: Gets a list of languages that the debugger supports.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.LastBreakReason
member.summary: Gets the last reason that a program was broken. If the program is running it returns DBG_REASON_NONE.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.LocalProcesses
member.summary: Gets the list of processes that currently running on this computer.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.OnlyLoadSymbolsManually
member.summary: Gets a value that determines whether symbols are loaded manually or automatically. The Visual Studio user can determine this setting in the Options dialog box. For more information about how to set this value within Visual Studio, see How to: Specify Symbol Locations and Loading Behavior.
member.returns: A Boolean value that is true if symbols must be loaded manually; false if symbols are loaded automatically.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.Parent
member.summary: Gets the immediate parent object of the object ().

member.name: M:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.RunToCursor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Executes the program to the current position of the source file cursor.
member.param: Set to true if this function call should wait until either Break mode or Design mode is entered before returning. Set to false if you want this call to return immediately after causing the debugger to begin execution. Upon return the debugger could be in Design, Break, or Run modes.For more information, see Code Stepping Overview.

member.name: M:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.SetNextStatement
member.summary: Sets the next instruction to be executed, according to the cursor position in the current source file.

member.name: M:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.SetSymbolSettings(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets various settings for the .PDB symbols used by Visual Studio for debugging and forces reloading of all symbols.
member.param: The path to the location of the .PDB symbol files.
A string that contains one character for each symbol path. If the symbol path is enabled, the character has a value of "1". If the symbol path not enabled, the character can have any other value.
The path to the location of the cache used for downloading symbols from a symbol server.
Set to true if symbols should only be loaded manually, false if symbols should be loaded automatically.
Set to true if symbols should be loaded immediately; otherwise false.

member.name: M:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.StepInto(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Steps into the next function call, if possible.
member.param: Set to true if this function call should wait until either Break mode or Design mode is entered before returning. Set to false if you want this call to return immediately after causing the debugger to begin execution. Upon return the debugger could be in Design, Break, or Run-mode.

member.name: M:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.StepOut(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Steps out of the current function.
member.param: Set to true if this function call should wait until either Break mode or Design mode is entered before returning. Set to false if you want this call to return immediately after causing the debugger to begin execution. Upon return the debugger could be in Design, Break, or Run modes.

member.name: M:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.StepOver(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Steps over the next function call.
member.param: Set to true if this function call should wait until either Break mode or Design mode is entered before returning. Set to false if you want this call to return immediately after causing the debugger to begin execution. Upon return the debugger could be in Design, Break, or Run modes.

member.name: M:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.Stop(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Stops debugging and terminates or detaches from all attached processes.
member.param: Set to true if the debugging session should stop only when it reaches Design mode. Set to false if you intend to stop debugging. However, you have to perform other tasks in the macro before the debugger enters design mode.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.SymbolCachePath
member.summary: Gets a string that contains the path to the symbols cache used by Visual Studio when you download symbols from a symbols server. You can specify the symbols cache path in the Options dialog box. For more information, see How to: Use a Symbol Server.
member.returns: A string that contains the path to the symbols cache.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.SymbolPath
member.summary: Gets a string that contains paths to .PDB symbol files that are used by Visual Studio for debugging. The Visual Studio user can specify symbols paths in the Options dialog box. For more information, see How to: Specify Symbol Locations and Loading Behavior.
member.returns: A string that contains a semicolon delimited list of paths to the .PDB symbol files.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.SymbolPathState
member.summary: Gets a string that represents the state of all symbol paths for the .PDB symbol files that are used by Visual Studio for debugging.
member.returns: A string that contains one character for each symbol path. If the symbol path is enabled, the character has a value of "1". If the symbol path not enabled, the character can have any other value.

member.name: M:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.TerminateAll
member.summary: Terminates all currently running debugging processes.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Debugger3.Transports
member.summary: Gets a collection of supported debugging transports.

member.name: T:EnvDTE90.HTMLWindow3

member.summary: Gets or sets the current HTML Editor window type.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.HTMLWindow3.CurrentView
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the HTML Editor window is in Source, Designer, or Split view.

member.summary: Pauses program execution until background processing completes.

member.name: T:EnvDTE90.Module
member.summary: Represents a module in a process that is being debugged.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Module.Collection
member.summary: Represents the collection of objects.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Module.DTE
member.summary: Gets the top-level extensibility object.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Module.EndAddress
member.summary: Gets the end of the address range for the module.
member.returns: A ULong value representing the address.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Module.Is64bit
member.summary: Gets whether the module is 64-bit.
member.returns: A boolean value; true if the module is 64-bit, false if otherwise.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Module.LoadAddress
member.summary: Gets the beginning load address for the module.
member.returns: A ULong value representing the address.

member.name: M:EnvDTE90.Module.LoadSymbols(System.String)
member.summary: Loads the symbols from the specified symbols file. This is equivalent to clicking the Load Symbols command on the context menu of the Modules window.
member.param: A string representing the path to the symbols file for the module.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Module.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the module (such as, "kernel32.dll"). corresponds to the Name column of the Modules window.
member.returns: A string value representing the name of the module.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Module.Optimized
member.summary: Gets whether the binary has been optimized. corresponds to the Optimized column of the Modules window.
member.returns: A boolean value; true if the binary is optimized, false if otherwise.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Module.Order
member.summary: Returns the load order of the module. corresponds to the Order column of the Modules window.
member.returns: A UInt value representing the load order.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Module.Parent
member.summary: Gets the immediate parent object of a object.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Module.Path
member.summary: Gets the full path to the module, such as c:\windows\system32\kernel32.dll. corresponds to the Path column of the Modules window.
member.returns: A string value representing the path to the module.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Module.Process
member.summary: Gets the process that contains this module.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Module.Rebased
member.summary: Gets whether the module loaded at its preferred load address.
member.returns: A boolean value; true if the module was rebased, that is, did not load at its preferred load address, false if otherwise.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Module.SymbolFile
member.summary: Gets the path to the symbol file for this module. Returns null if symbols were not loaded.
member.returns: A string representing the path to the module's symbol file.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Module.UserCode
member.summary: Gets whether the debugger is currently considers this module "UserCode." corresponds to the UserCode column of the Modules window. Applies to managed code only.
member.returns: A boolean value; true if "UserCode," false if otherwise.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Module.Version
member.summary: Gets the version string for the module.
member.returns: A string value representing the version of the module.

member.summary: Causes the debugger to attach this process.

member.summary: Similar to , causes the debugger to attach this process, except that it allows you to specify an engine or set of engines.
member.param: A collection.

member.name: M:EnvDTE90.Process3.Break(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Causes the given process to pause its execution so that its current state can be analyzed.
member.param: Set to true to return only when the debugger has entered break mode. Set to false to break and return immediately. See Breaking Execution for more information.

member.name: M:EnvDTE90.Process3.Detach(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Causes the debugger to detach from this process.
member.param: Set to true if the debugging session should stop only when it reaches a break or the end. Set to false if you intend to stop debugging, but you have to perform other tasks in the macro before the debugger breaks or ends. See Breaking Execution for more information.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Process3.DTE
member.summary: Gets the top-level extensibility object, the object.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Process3.IsBeingDebugged

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Process3.ProcessID
member.summary: Gets the ID number assigned to this process.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Process3.Programs

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Process3.Threads
member.summary: Gets the threads associated with this process.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Process3.Transport
member.summary: Gets the being used to debug this process.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Process3.UserName

member.name: T:EnvDTE90.Solution3
member.summary: Represents all projects and solution-wide properties in the integrated development environment (IDE). Supersedes and .

member.name: M:EnvDTE90.Solution3.AddFromFile(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a project to the solution that is based on a project file already stored in the system.
member.param: Required. The full path and file name of the project file.

Optional. Indicates whether the project loads in the current solution or its own solution; true if the current solution is closed and the project is added to a new solution, false if the project is added to the existing, open solution.

member.name: M:EnvDTE90.Solution3.AddFromTemplate(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Copies an existing project file, and any items or subdirectories it contains, to the specified location and adds it to the solution.
member.param: Required. The full path and file name with extension of the template project file.
Required. The full path of the directory in which to copy the contents of .
Required. The name of the project file in the destination directory. This should include the extension. The displayed name is derived from .

Optional. Indicates whether the project loads in the current solution or its own; true if the current solution is closed and the project is added to a new solution, false if the project is added to the existing, open solution.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Solution3.AddIns
member.summary: Gets an collection, which contains all currently available add-ins associated with the solution.

member.name: M:EnvDTE90.Solution3.AddSolutionFolder(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a solution folder to a collection.
member.param: The name of the solution folder.

member.name: M:EnvDTE90.Solution3.Close(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Closes the current solution.
member.param: Optional. Indicates whether to save the solution before closing it; true if the solution should be saved prior to closing it, false if not.

member.name: P:EnvDTE90.Solution3.Count
member.summary: Gets a value indicating the number of projects in the solution.
member.returns: The number of projects in the solution.

member.name: M:EnvDTE90.Solution3.Create(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an empty solution in the specified directory with the specified name.

Required. The name to display in Solution Explorer. This is also the base name of the .sln and .suo files.

member.summary: Gets the top-level extensibility object.
